overview: The Integrated Design Studios focus on the successful union of architecture and engineering in building design. With strong involvement from consultants and clients from industry the studios provide an excellent opportunity to experience how design happens in practice in an environment emulating a design office. Students from both disciplines work together to develop building designs for real clients with a focus on sustainable practices, including zero carbon and renewable energy technologies. You will learn how to view design from both engineering and architectural perspectives and express ideas based in well-grounded, informed critical thinking. The studio includes basic building envelope and energy analysis components and engenders development of integrated design skills and understanding able to be employed in building designs in industry. Each studio uses a building typology specific to the industry client involved as a case study. Sustainable integrated design solutions appropriate to the building typology in question will be researched and developed throughout the studios.

assessments.description:
Attendance  - Active Studio participation in, and contribution to, integrated Architect-Engineer group work. 2 x 2 hours per week.
Addressing Intended Learning  Outcomes (ILOs) 1-8.. 52 hours. Hurdle requirement:. Attendance at a minimum of 75% of all classes.

Oral presentation - Contribution to background building technologies research.
ILOs 1,2,7 & 8 are addressed.. 18 hours

Report -
Critical analysis of engineering technologies for the design development of studio project typology, with opportunities for integration into architecture. 500 words equivalent. ILOs 1-8 are addressed.. 20 hours (of work required)
Oral presentation - Mid-semester jury review, critique. ILOs 1-8 are addressed.. 15 hours

Report -
Innovative technologies that address building envelope/energy solutions integrating with the architectural design. 2,500 words equivalent.
ILOs 1-8 are addressed.. 80 hours (of work required)
Oral presentation  - End-of-semester jury review, critique. ILOs 1-8 are addressed.. 15 hours

Semester 1.Contact hours: 48 hours (12 hrs of lectures per semester, 36 hours of collaborative work in a design studio).

Semester 2.Contact hours: 48 hours (12 hrs of lectures per semester, 36 hours of collaborative work in a design studio).

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.

About the Community Access Program (CAP): This subject is available through theCommunity Access Program(also called Single Subject Studies) which allows you to enrol in single subjects offered by the University of Melbourne, without the commitment required to complete a whole degree.
Entry requirements including prerequisites may apply. Please refer to theCAP applications pagefor further information.
